description.narrative: 1. Contribution to food security. Based on competitive cost structure, quality, efficient distribution network and service, the projects are expected to increase the availability of tractors and harvest combines in their regions. This, in turn, should help improve the agricultural productivity and thus output, and contribute to food security. 2. Contribution to rural development: Increased mechanization of the agriculture in the region is expected to lead to higher farmer income as well as development of small businesses that provide spare parts and maintenance/ repair services for the agricultural machinery. 3. Job preservation in a frontier region. By supporting the continuation of the Croatian Company''s post-privatization restructuring, IFC''s investment is expected to ensure the preservation of at least 300 jobs at the plant, and help increase indirect employment in the supply chain and distribution network of the SDF group in the region through the Company''s growth.

SAME DEUTZ FAHR Zetelice d.o.o. is a producer of combine harvesters, located in Zupanja, Croatia. It was privatized in 2005 when it was acquired by the Italian producer of agricultural machinery, SAME DEUTZ FAHR Group SpA (SDF). Since the acquisition, SDF revamped the Companys operations by modernizing its machinery and operations, consolidating SDFs European harvest combine production on its site, introducing new products, and making it one of SDFs main logistics centers. The project consists of introduced leading edge harvesting technology into the Croatian company and gearing it to become a major exporter and distribution center for Europe and the CIS.
